input_text:
Job Title: Sr. Project Manager

Location: Washington DC-Baltimore Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Position: Sr. Project ManagerLocation: Washington, DC (once a week onsite)Salary: $110,000 - $130,000 per yearJob Type: Full-time, Permanent
About Us:We are a dynamic organization specializing in providing IT solutions for federal/government projects. Our team is dedicated to delivering high-quality services and products while adhering to strict compliance and regulatory standards.
Role Overview:We are seeking an experienced IT Project Manager with expertise in Scrum and Agile methodologies, ideally with prior experience in federal or government projects. The successful candidate will serve as a pivotal figure in our project management team, driving successful project outcomes while maintaining effective communication with key stakeholders and ensuring adherence to project timelines and deliverables.
Responsibilities:Serve as the day-to-day leader for project team members, coordinating priorities, acting as an escalation point for questions and concerns, and reviewing and approving time worked.Identify, influence, and communicate with key stakeholders, ensuring alignment with project goals and objectives.Act as a liaison between various business departments and groups, relaying important information between Federal leadership and contractors.Maintain comprehensive documentation regarding projects, processes, and operations, including bi-weekly sprint reporting and monthly status reports.Collaborate with project managers and cross-functional teams to ensure seamless project execution and delivery.Effectively communicate and influence key stakeholders to support proposed strategies, process improvements, and operational decisions.Demonstrate resourcefulness and the ability to devise creative solutions to complex problems.Utilize ITIL processes to effectively manage IT operations.Coach teams on Agile methodologies (Scrum) best practices.
Requirements:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field (Master's degree preferred).Proven experience as an IT Project Manager, ideally with a focus on federal or government projects.Experience with any of the following: ServiceNow, SharePoint, Salesforce and DrupalStrong proficiency in Scrum and Agile methodologies.Excellent communication and leadership skills, with the ability to effectively interact with stakeholders at all levels.Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines.Experience with ITIL processes for IT operations management.Certifications such as PMP, CSM, or PMI-ACP are a plus.Ability to work effectively in a remote environment.
Benefits:Competitive salary and benefits package.Opportunities for professional development and growth.Collaborative and inclusive work culture.
If you are a proactive and results-driven IT Project Manager with a passion for driving successful project outcomes in a federal/government setting, we encourage you to apply! Please submit your resume and cover letter detailing your relevant experience and qualifications. We look forward to welcoming you to our team.

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.title: Sr. Project Manager
output_json.summary: Experienced IT Project Manager with expertise in Scrum and Agile methodologies, ideally with prior experience in federal or government projects.
preferred_degrees: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field
required_skills: Proven experience as an IT Project Manager
Experience with ServiceNow, SharePoint, Salesforce, and Drupal
Strong proficiency in Scrum and Agile methodologies
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Experience with ITIL processes for IT operations management
Ability to work effectively in a remote environment
optional_skills: Certifications such as PMP, CSM, or PMI-ACP
job_responsibilities: Serve as the day-to-day leader for project team members
Identify, influence, and communicate with key stakeholders
Collaborate with project managers and cross-functional teams
Effectively communicate and influence key stakeholders
Utilize ITIL processes to manage IT operations
Coach teams on Agile methodologies (Scrum) best practices
benefits: Opportunities for professional development and growth
output_json.company_information: Dynamic organization specializing in providing IT solutions for federal/government projects

other.content: Competitive salary and benefits package, opportunities for professional development and growth, collaborative and inclusive work culture
